result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Charles Andrew Hartwig in court with Attorney Robert S. Duxstad in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin.
State complied with Victim Witness Notification.  WOPH on 22-CF-90.  PQW filed and reviewed.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial.
10:20 a.m. case is addressed as to modification of bond conditions.  ADA Lantta addresses the court.  Atty Duxstad responds.  Court finds it will not further modify the bond conditions.  Set for ARGN.  Atty Duxstad files a request for substitution of Judge and further court proceedings will be set with that assignment.

10:14 AM Defendant Charles Andrew Hartwig in court.  Attorney Robert S. Duxstad in court for Charles Andrew Hartwig.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. State complied with Victim Witness Notification. The State has also informed the court of a new case filed, 22CF96. The State asks the court to adopt his motion for bond modification. Attorney Duxstad argues modification. The Court denies the states motion to modify bond. The current bond will stand. Matter set over for preliminary hearing.
Motion hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
